div.p: FEELING OR SITUATION of one's MIND being in CHAOS.
1. The standard general word for any kind of confusion is huò 惑 (ant. qīng 清 "be unconfused and clear").
2. Mí 迷 "be temporarily disorientated" (ant. shí 識 "be familiar with") is in connection with a direction one is intending to take.
3. Hūn 昏 / 惛 is typically confusion within a certain delimited area. See OBSCURE
4. Bèi 悖 / 誖 / 勃 refers to confusion in the form of contradictoriness and incoherence of opinions held or of attitudes.
困惑 refers to a state of perplexion and puzzlement.
rough draft to BEGIN TO identify synonym group members for analysis, based on CL etc. 18.11.2003. CH ／

entry.def: Luàn 亂 refers to a chaotic state of mind.

sense.def: CC: emotionally confused 心煩意了
be ambiguous and unclear; be unfocussed
(cause to be confused>) sow doubt on, cast doubt on; cause to be ambiguous
be all upside down and incoherent

entry.def: Bèi 悖/誖/勃 refers to confusion in the form of contradictoriness and incoherence of opinions held or of attitudes. xxx
Bèi 悖/誖/勃 refers to confusion in the form of contradictoriness and incoherence of opinions held or of attitudes. xxx
Bèi 悖/誖/勃 refers to confusion in the form of contradictoriness and incoherence of opinions held or of attitudes. xxx

sense.def: be misguided, be incoherent (also of actions); look confused
be reduced to a state of confusion

entry.def: The standard general word for any kind of confusion is huò 惑 (ant. qīng 清 "be unconfused and clear").

sense.def: cause to become confused; cause to be confused
be led into confusion; be confused about, be confused by
consider as thoroughly confused in mind
惑於利"be confused by (the prospect of) profit, be mislead by

entry.def: Hūn 昏/惛 is typically confusion within a certain delimited area. See OBSCURE

sense.def: to be confused; to be stupid
cause to be confused; to confuse
be in a confused psychological state; of a person: bewildered
rare, poetic: worried, disturbed and confused; be all confused
read yíng: loanword for : be confused
be puzzled about somebody > worry about somebody
be mentally beclouded and blind to the facts
become mentally beclouded and blind to the facts around one
be confused about, be in the dark about
be dazzled; have one's mind elsewhere

entry.def: Mí 迷 "be temporarily disorientated" (ant. shí 識 "be familiar with") is in connection with a direction one is intending to take.

sense.def: gone astray > confused, deluded, disoriented, ignorant of the truth
be disorientated; confused, temporarily misguided, deluded
make confused, cause to be confusedly visible
have things upside down> be confused

bibl.title: A Dictionary of Chinese Buddhist Terms

sense.def: BUDDH: the three kinds of confusions/delusions SOOTHILL 65: " 三惑 A Tiantai classification of the three delusions, also styled 三煩惱; 三漏; 三垢; 三結; trials or temptations, leakages, uncleannesses, and bonds. The first of the following three is common to all disciples, the two last to bodhisattvas. They arise from (a) 見, 思, 惑 things seen and thought, i.e. illusions from imperfect perception, with temptation to love, hate, etc.; to be rid of these false views and temptations is the discipline and nirvāā of ascetic or Hīnayāna Buddhists. Mahāyāna proceeds further in and by its bodhisattva aims, which produce their own difficulties, i.e. (b) 塵沙惑 illusion and temptation through the immense variety of duties in saving men; and (c) 無明惑 illusions and temptations that arise from failure philosophically to understand things in their reality."
get confused, lose one's mental orientation
confused DCD 4: 謂心意迷亂。 漢 劉向 《列女傳‧陳女夏姬》：“三為王后，七為夫人，公侯爭之，莫不迷惑失意。”
be vague; be diffuse; be all confused; cultivate vague illusion and confusion of mind
following no principles; without rhyme or reason
late and colloquial: lack action (or a proper response) > do not know what to do; be at a loss (ZTJ possibly earliest source for this word; see JINGDECHUANDENGLU)
be all up in knots; be all confused
cause to be misguided and confused
lose one's way in difficult terrain
be confusedly attached to; be confused so as to be attached to
be out of one's depth; be at one's wit's end; be completely lost for words; not know what to think or say
be blacked out, be dead to the world (See Zhuangzi 2 喪其偶)
be all confused; be complex and confusing
= mao4 眊, be confused, be in utter confusion
in a confused manner; being in a confused state of mind
†create confusion in†, are inconsistent in relation to N
be blinded and confused concerning N; be oblivious of the reality of N
=誘惑 be confused or seduced by things
=悖誖 be inconsistent, be incoherent, be wrong-headed
